data.title: Adjust the bounds of structures in TD
data.body:
My brother was so kind to do those little adjustments, he also made images for you (reviewers)! ;)
(Unfortunately he used different ingame colors, but whatever.)

![bounds1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13293717/26a4a916-db21-11e5-90b0-8039be0fc4a2.png) ![bounds2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13293722/2b6124b6-db21-11e5-8b08-314a7efba08e.png) ![bounds3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13293726/31d0fb5a-db21-11e5-920f-8fe911f53799.png)
![bounds4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13293729/337506a4-db21-11e5-943c-389d39903c58.png) ![bounds5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13293732/36e4e46c-db21-11e5-8695-830ba17e17ff.png)
(He also tweaked the bounds of `PYLE` a bit, but it's hardly noticeable anyway, as he just "cut" the bounds so that they don't overlap with the bib too much.)

data.title: Adjust the (visual) selection bounds of the Windmill and the Lighthouse
data.body:
Removed `SelectionDecorations` entirely from the `LHUS` definition as that trait gets inherited and uses the `Bounds` values of `Selectable` by default.

Before:
![boundsmillhusformer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13293046/64e78f70-db1e-11e5-83e7-fcb94686bc22.png)
After:
![boundsmillhus](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13293043/632f0942-db1e-11e5-84ec-7fc1b8daaa16.png)
(Note: The windmill has smaller "selection-bounds" than "visible bounds".)

data.title: HealthInit support
data.body: Currently you can't change the actor's health without manually editing the `map.yaml` which is inconvenient.

data.title: DeployedStateInit support
data.body: You can't place `gadpsa` #9501 and `gatick` #9509 anymore.

data.title: Fixed lobby self-kicking when clicking start game quickly
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/LobbyLogic.cs#L742 sets the map to null so I can easily check against that. The problems appears when you click skirmish and immediately the start game button. If a debugger is attached and the map check is slowed down this will frequently happen. The game will even kick you in skirmish games which are technically a local server with one client.

data.title: Units can walk below veinholes
data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/13266974/f0053778-da7a-11e5-8c68-4a1039ddeabe.png)

data.title: Fixed selectable crash sites
data.body: These are decorational actors like rocks which shouldn't have a health bar. They also still contained internal developer tooltips which aren't really atmospheric.

data.title: Added damaging through Veins.
data.body: `-PoisonedByTiberium:` is currently the http://modenc.renegadeprojects.com/ImmuneToVeins equivalent. This is the easy part of getting veins to work.

data.title: subs "underwater" do not take damage from nukes
data.body:
on a direct hit 

thats is just wrong , for the nuke there should be a exception on this sub-rule imo

data.title: Does not work combine many PNG in SHP.
data.body:
Help me combine 8bits PNG in one common SHP. 
I tried OpenRA.Utility.exe --shp file1.png file2.png, file3.png ...and so on.Image size was the same, indexed color.But in the end it did not work. Help, please since I am new to this.

data.title: More control abilities for upgrades
data.body:
The upgrades seems to be quite limited once you have to work with multiple ones affecting the same unit.

As example I have an artillery unit.

Its base weapon is enabled by default. There are 3 possible upgrades for it, which the player can pick two out of three (in this example I only added 2 upgrades so far).

Each upgrade does change the weapon and disables the default one. But I also want to achieve that once you have chosen two upgrades the first lvl 1 upgrade gets disabled too - leaving only the lvl 2 weapon active.

Now the problem is this that there seems no possibility to disable the lvl 1 weapon, the unit ends up with two weapons instead.

http://pastebin.com/QXcPSNJa

data.title: Option to "lock the session" on dedicated servers.
data.body:
In addition to already being able to close the slots in order to prevent further players to join and the ability to disable specs by ticking the approriate box in order to flush all specs out at once, a "lock session" tickbox would also be handy, allowing you to effectively lock the session to keep the current amount of specs/players in, whilst  disallowing more to join.

This would enable the session admin to keep the current specs already present but prevents further specs to overflow the session. This would make "havin' a few specs, but not too many" much easier. Especially handy for tournaments, streams and events.

data.title: Added the Devastator self destruction
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4926. This also splits MadTank into more reusable parts: `AttackSeismic` for the screen shaking and chronoshift prevention and `AttackDetonates` for the charging and explosion as well as using the existing `WithChargeAnimation`/`Overlay`.

data.body:
Damaged helicopter sending to repair and after that to Ammorefill with Shift pressed leads to a game crash. See replay

data.title: Directional idle animations
data.body: In Red Alert 2 and Tiberian Sun sequence setups you will notice appendixes like S, W which indicate directions the unit needs to be facing to give a smooth transition from stand to idle animations.

data.title: Added WithExitOverlay rendered when the actor is leaving production
data.body: Red Alert 2 has a different approach to war factory rendering. Instead of door opening/closing animations it simply draws overlays which a) hide the produced vehicle with a roof and b) add open door overlays. This was a bit weird to understand, but it is quite controllable when playing around with Z offsets. In followup pull requests this will differentiate per queue to allow the roof opening overlays for helicopters and airships.

data.title: Fix broken dev commands
data.body:
Fixes #10683.

Not sure if that's really the way we should be going to solve this, but it does the job with minimal impact. A proper solution would likely require heavy surgery to the way we instantiate the widget tree.

I explained the problem itself in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10683#issuecomment-179478285:

> So all the *Commands do their thing in WorldLoaded. IngameChatLogic gathers all the commands in its constructor.
> 
> As it turns out, the widgets themselves are created during LoadWidgetAtGameStart's WorldLoaded method, which, as LoadWidgetAtGameStart is declared as one of the first traits in world.yaml, runs before the WorldLoaded method of the *Commands traits.

data.title: Add ability to collect system information from users' systems
data.body:
Closes #10662.

Edit: Just to be sure: DON'T MERGE BEFORE THE REDIRECT ON master.openra.net IS SET UP!

data.title: Added exit codes to CheckSequenceSprites
data.body: otherwise it will always exit with 0 indicating CI services that everything is fine.

data.title: Update license header for 2016 and GPLv3+.
data.body: Fixes #9626.

data.title: Fix LobbyCommands not validating user-modifiable input
data.body:
Fixes #10330.
Fixes #10342.

![screenshot from 2016-02-21 16 27 17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/13203474/7d9a5cc6-d8b9-11e5-9a11-8e24f908ff0d.png)

data.title: [RA] Nerf Demo Truck and A-Bomb damage against air units.
data.body:
At ground 0 everything ought to be killed as the current state but IMO for air units, the range is too wide (aproximately 10 cells radius).

Hinds:
![hinds 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13203028/56358b6c-d8ad-11e5-80e6-166699841d15.png)
![hinds 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13203029/579987d8-d8ad-11e5-874c-e0f973fec5d7.png)

Yaks:
![yak 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13203035/8d4340ae-d8ad-11e5-8324-faa4ce889d4f.png)
![yak 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13203037/91fe8b3a-d8ad-11e5-8a39-a2b5b8f7d7da.png)

Logically air units are more resilient against nuke blasts than ground targets.

Balance wise I think it's a good idea to not allow the nuke truck to completely wipe out a nearby (very expensive) air fleet 7-10 cells away. Scouting for nuke trucks should be rewarded. Sniping nuke trucks with air units already guarantees the attacker a loss ($1350 Hind/YAK).

data.title: [RA] Official Map Pool: Alter Encounter (6 players) - balance, aesthetics
data.body:
[**Encounter, current**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7290/), (6 players)

Changes:
Make the corner ridges more symmetrical.
Make all ridges more distinctive.
Balance east/west ore patches for corner player spawns.

[**Encounter, altered**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9516/), incl. fixed bottom right player spawn..

![encounter compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13379382/42983c7c-de24-11e5-8474-f95630f17a6f.png)

![encounter compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13379406/08dd1114-de25-11e5-9708-092017ba6a42.png)

data.title: Fix mod updater and clear out legacy rules.
data.body: Fixes #10793 and applies some desperately needed dejunking by removing all upgrade rules earlier than the last release.

data.title: Option to "lock the map" on dedicated servers. (Greying out the "Change Map"-button / Themed servers )
data.body:
Super self-explaining, and totally important feature needed for servers.

The ability to set - for example - something in the veins of "lock.map=true", effectively greying out the "change map" button even for the admin (person joining first), so that the map the server starts/loops with (that is defined under map=) cannot be changed.

This would enable us to have themed servers, e.g. servers dedicated to minigames like Fort Lonestar.
_
A step further would be to have "map pool" for the server, instead of just deleting all unwated maps from the servers' map repository, but that is another story for another day..._

data.title: Fixed screen map updates for invisible mobile actors
data.body: Some traits already kept that in mind, but not all of them. Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10766 and related crashes.
